headline.main: World Briefing | Asia: Nepal: India Is Asked For Help To Fight Rebels

lead_paragraph: The government has asked India for helicopters and ammunition to fight a Maoist rebellion that began in 1996 and has cost about 350 lives in just the past week. A spokeswoman for India's Ministry of External Affairs said India's prime minister, Atal Behari Vajpayee, had assured King Gyanendra, the constitutional monarch of Nepal, ''that India was ready to extend whatever assistance was required.'' Nepal declared a state of emergency on Monday so it could mobilize the army against the rebels. Celia W. Dugger (NYT)
abstract: Government of Nepal asks India for helicopters and ammunition to fight Maoist rebellion that began in 1996 and has cost about 350 lives in just past week; spokeswoman says Prime Min Atal Behari Vajpayee of India has assured King Gyanendra that India is ready to give whatever help is needed (S)
